title: Zig static blog for GitHub Pages (minimal)
description:
Build a minimal static blog generator in Zig 0.15.2 for https://tkersey.github.io.

Requirements:
- Content: Markdown posts in posts/*.md with YAML front matter delimited by --- ... ---.
- Front matter: required fields title + date; simple YAML subset (scalars + tags list). Optional fields may include description, tags, draft, slug.
- Markdown flavor: GFM-ish (tables/strikethrough/autolinks if supported by chosen renderer).
- Output: flat URLs (slug.html), index.html, feed.xml (RSS 2.0), style.css, optional minimal JS only if justified.
- Preview: zig build serve serves the generated site and watches for changes to rebuild (manual browser refresh is fine).
- Deploy: GitHub Actions builds and deploys to GitHub Pages; generated site is NOT committed.
- First version: skip syntax highlighting.

title: Repo + config skeleton
description: Add baseline repo files (README, .gitignore), site.yml schema, and expected directories (posts/, static/, dist/).

title: Zig project scaffold + CLI
description:
Scaffold the Zig 0.15.2 project and build/serve workflow.

- Adds `blog` executable with `build` and `serve` subcommands.
- `zig build` (default) generates placeholder HTML into `dist/` from `posts/*.md`.
- `zig build serve` serves `dist/` locally (no watch/rebuild yet).

Where:
- `build.zig`, `build.zig.zon`
- `src/main.zig`, `src/cli.zig`, `src/site.zig`, `src/server.zig`

Verification:
- `zig fmt build.zig src/*.zig`
- `zig build`
- `zig build test`
design:
- Zig 0.15 build system uses `root_module`; create a private module via `b.createModule` and pass it to `b.addExecutable`/`b.addTest`.
- Make `zig build` generate `dist/` by setting `b.default_step` to a run step that invokes `blog build`.
- Implement a minimal `blog serve` HTTP file server using `std.net` + `std.http.Server`, with basic path traversal protection.
- Keep generated output git-clean by writing under `dist/` (which already contains its own `.gitignore`).
acceptance_criteria:
- `zig fmt build.zig src/*.zig`
- `zig build` generates `dist/index.html`
- `zig build test`
- `zig build serve` starts a server on http://127.0.0.1:8080 (or custom host/port via `blog serve --host/--port`)
notes:
Closure Notes
- Outcome: Zig project scaffolded with `blog` CLI + `zig build` steps; `zig build` generates placeholder pages into `dist/`, and `zig build serve` serves `dist/` locally.
- Key learnings: Zig 0.15 uses `zig init` (no `zig init-exe`) and build definitions require `root_module`/`createModule`.
- Decisions + rationale: Set `b.default_step` to site generation so `zig build` produces the artifact; keep `serve` minimal (no watch) but safe against `..` traversal.
- Constraints / invariants discovered: `dist/` is generated; preserve `dist/.gitignore`; only serve files under `dist/`.

title: Pick + integrate Markdown renderer
description: Evaluate Zig-native Markdown options (koino/zigdown/zmd/etc) vs C-based cmark-gfm. Choose smallest pragmatic option that supports GFM-ish output on Zig 0.15.2 and integrate via build.zig.zon.

title: Parse YAML front matter
description: Implement YAML front matter extraction + parsing (simple subset). Required: title/date; optional: description/tags/draft/slug.

title: Generate HTML pages
description: Generate index.html + per-post slug.html using a minimal template (no dark mode). Ensure links + assets work for root Pages URL.

title: Generate RSS feed
description: Generate RSS 2.0 feed at feed.xml with correct base_url (https://tkersey.github.io), dates, and descriptions.

title: Copy static assets

title: Preview server + watch/rebuild
